Name: Bone dice
Description: Well-preserved bone example of Roman dice, with the numerals from 1 to 6 cut as double concentric circles for each digit. The game is typical of Greek and Roman culture, imported into Egypt in the last centuries BC and, under Roman rule, first centuries AD. This example was excavated at the large provincial town of Oxyrhynchus, famous for the vast finds of papyri of the Roman Period.
